title: Splash Screen for Type Website
content:
This is for a class. I'm creating a splash page for a typography website.   
please critique   
   
 ![artsp.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524130047im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/3262.jpg)   
   
Thanks
author: wandar

comments.content:
Pretty nice!   
Probably use a font with less contrast, maybe blockier, like Charter? And tweak the spacing: "RT", "TY", "RA" and "HY" too loose, "OG" too tight.   
   
hhp

I found that the background is overpowering the title. Took everyones advice. I darkened the background. And used a block serif font   
   
 ![art-72-2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524130047im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/3263.jpg)
I still think the background images overpower the type. I bet you could strip out a few layers and still have a nice piece.
